feed.title: Category: nm | a m4lefic security blog

entry.title: NM
entry.content:
NM

Notes and material referenced from SecurityTube GDB Primer & GNU Binutils docs

This section will cover the GNU utility NM. nm lists symbols from object files. It can give us a quick way to analyze different debug symbols in a binary.

  • the output is split into 3 columns by default Virtual Address Symbol Type Symbol Name

  • lower case letter is a local symbol
  • upper case letter is an external symbol

common nm usage can be seen below - nm exe - nm -a calc_DEBUG|grep ‘function’ displays all symbols and we can grep for specific function - nm -n calc_DEBUG displays a list of all symbols sorted by address - nm -g calc_DEBUG displays a list of external symbols - nm -S calc_DEBUG|grep ‘function’ displays the size in bytes of reserved memory
